data_table.description: Widespread and Regional Pain Data, Original and Offspring Cohorts through 2001. Data collected include total number of joint pain sites and presence of widespread pain.

variable.name: widespreadpain
variable.comment: Widespread pain is classified as pain above and below the waist, on the left and right hand sides of the body and in the axial skeleton. See protocol for algorithm.
variable.value: Other pain, reports pain in a joint, but that pain does not meet the criteria

variable.name: TJC1
variable.description: Total joint count, hand and feet collapsed
variable.comment: This count is calculated by counting up the total number of pain sites where the participant reported having pain. The hands and feet were counted as 1 site each for this total. See protocol for further explanation.

variable.name: TJC2
variable.description: Total joint count, hand and feet included
variable.comment: This count is calculated by counting up the total number of pain sites where the participant reported having pain. The hands and feet could contribute as many as 15 sites each for this total. See protocol for further explanation.
